title: Sadako Ogata | UC Berkeley Political Science

time_markers.text: just before the Free Speech Movement
quotes: just before the Free Speech Movement, and people were questioning a lot of values.
Sadako Ogata (Japan): 1990 - 2000 (n.d.). UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency
In her book 'The Turbulent Decade - Confronting the Refugee Crises of the 1990s', she described her stint at the UN as a period of constant humanitarian crises.

organizations.name: UNHCR
quotes: At UNHCR, Ogata oversaw large-scale emergency operations in northern Iraq, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, and the Great Lakes region of Africa.

organizations.name: UN
quotes: In her book 'The Turbulent Decade - Confronting the Refugee Crises of the 1990s', she described her stint at the UN as a period of constant humanitarian crises.

organizations.name: UN Chronicle
quotes: 'I have often been asked from where I draw my energy,' she said in an op-ed for UN Chronicle.

organizations.name: Japan’s upper house of Parliament
quotes: 'Women were not expected to serve in such high-ranking positions in international agencies,' said Kuniko Inoguchi, a member of Japan’s upper house of Parliament and a friend of Ms. Ogata’s.
